title: Wonder practic
body: You can always see a Dr if needed I saw a Dr yesterday who was amazing caring and so helpful cannot praise this surgery enough after all the problem we endured at our old one so different caring polite helpful just wonderful all of the staff

title: Amazing staff
body:
I was in a&e Tuesday night, although it was packed and waiting times were long, every member of staff was polite, professional, calm and did their best to deal with everyone the best they could. The doctor was very calm and sweet to me as I have a huge fear of needles and blood tests. 
The door security staff were amazing Iâ€™ve never seen such friendly helpful security before anywhere, they went out their way for people, so polite and friendly, even bought round blankets for those of us stuck there all night, my mom got lost trying to find Costa upstairs so one of the security took her there. Having spent a lot of time in hospital over the years after a serious accident and being physically disabled, Iâ€™ve got to say Iâ€™ve never seen security staff like this. Just like to thank all the staff there that made my visit that night bearable. Thankyou.

title: Great practice
body: I would like to thank all the staff in labour ward your all so amazing & special your so great at ur job so keep it up your manger should be proud of u all because of how good you all are .. ur the best , you all have great communication skills and great patient care . Staff like you all deserve to know how great you are itâ€™s not just your job the difference is you do it with love & care thank you so much for everything really appreciate it hats off to the staff & student nurses keep it going .

title: Care and kindness
body: My mum was taken into Critical care and remained there for 9 hours before being transferred to the MAU. The staff were so kind and caring to my mum and to my brother and I. I would highly recommend using Chorley Hospital.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding Care and Compassion
body: My mother fell downstairs on 21st January and was admitted to Treliske A&E.  I would like to name the particular member of staff that made so much difference to me with her outstanding communication but I understand this isn't possible on this form?  The regular calls made such a difference, I can't tell you how it relieved my fear and anxiety.  I wanted to thank the staff member specifically.

title: Excellent Customer Service
body: The person making the first delivery of ambulatory and non-ambulatory oxygen arrived within the specified time-band and was friendly, helpful, well informed, efficient; what more could one ask for ?

title: Fantastic people and care
body: I have been coming to this practice for a while and i can say my experience with them has been outstanding! The ladies at the recption are very friendly and helpful. The nurses always make me feel comfortable. I'm normally very nervious when it comes to do blood test and smear test but these nurses are very patients and always manage to make me feel relax. The drs are warm and really care about your well-being. It feels like talking to a friend or a familly member. I have full trust in this surgery. Thank you guys for everything you do to improve our mental and physical health!

title: Very efficient service
body: Very pleased with the service I received. The information for was insightful and the support was great.

title: Brilliant service
body: I loved the service. The Doctor was really friendly and so were the reception staff. Would highly recommend them.

title: Wonderful service!
body: I felt listened to about the extent of my pain for the first time. Never had a check up so thorough. It was so nice to be seen as more than a pregnant person. She was so professional and caring that I almost fell asleep during the procedure and am genuinely looking forward to the rest of my dental treatment with her. I know itâ€™s not a permanent fix but thank you for taking away my pain and giving me confidence in a dentist for the first time. Youâ€™ve increased my quality of life and made me able to mother my toddler properly again! See you in September x

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Professionalism from Reception
body: I would like to thank the person with whom I spoke at the surgery reception. Specifically for their  professionalism, patience and effective listening to my individual circumstances. They went through a number of options, explaining why certain things couldnâ€™t happen but in the end the solution that was arrived at, turned out to be ideal for me personally. Thank you.

title: First class treatment
body: Both my consultation and treatment for cataract surgery was very professional. Both staff and consultants made me aware of the procedures step by step and made me feel at ease. Would recommend SpaMedica to all my family and friends.

title: Absolutely amazing childrens ward and staff
body: My daughter got admitted to the childrens ward with severe tonsillitis, she is only 5 and it was very frightening how poorly she was for her and myself but every single member of staff reassured us, looked after us and supported us through our three night stay on the childrens ward. I cannot thank all staff members enough - what incredible people from the play team to nurses to doctors. Thank you so much for looking after us I couldnâ€™t recommend this hospital enough.

title: Great care
body: Always an excellent Surgery. Helpful and professional. Reception staff are always attentive and try to find solutions. Over the years the medical staff have been consistently professional and caring.

title: Fantastic Doctor Support
body: Several Doctors and staff go beyond their remit of their Job description and care and support you outside of the surgery times. I would highly recommend this surgery to everyone. They supported my wife and I during the pandemic when she was diagnosed with progressive MS. At one point we though that we would loose my wife but the care and support we received was beyond incredible from the surgery. My wife is here today thanks to several of the doctors at the surgery and I could never thank them enough for what they have done for our family.

title: Excellent Service and Care
body: I cannot thank the staff on duty enough for the care they showed me . I was feeling rather unwell, and their professional attitude at all times and keeping me informed throughout my visit was very reassuring not only for me but also my husband. Thank you to everyone involved in my care.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Such considerate care
body: I was in Majors B today with my very elderly mother. Despite being short staffed, we were treated with kindness and respect by a competent team. Thank you all.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Such considerate care
body: I was in Majors B today with my very elderly mother. Despite being short staffed, we were treated with kindness and respect by a competent team. Thank you all.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: E.N.T
body:
Brilliant, Long story short. After four months of suffering with ears and my doctor not knowing what to do, I eventual went to E.N.T. at Linacre. Super efficiency In less than one hour and on time I was examined, Tested, Treated. One week later my ears where sorted out and when I went back two week later, seen on time and left in fifteen minute's.  The staff and Doctors, Ten out of Ten.
Thank You.

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Great Practice
body: I completed klink for an appointment on the 26th June received a text message the next day with an appointment face to face on the 9th July. I was given a thought examination by the GP with a full diagnosis not rushed and very professional. Great work

title: Brilliant service
body: I was referred as a 2wr to gynae and was seen in under a week on Saturday 9th July. I was understandably worried and nervous about the appointment (because of previous history) the Consultant and her Nurse (wish I could put names) were brilliant, made the whole experience less daunting and because of their rapport together I got through a worrying appointment, scan & biopsy in a almost relaxing situation, all I needed was someone to understand my previous experiences and to talk to me and they certainly couldnâ€™t have been better, with all the negative times that hospitals and GP surgeries are coping with I can only Thank the whole service from the original GP consultation on the Tuesday, to having a scan on the Saturday and seeing a Consultant on the following Saturday how can we complain about thatâ€¦â€¦what an amazing service at a worrying time!!!!!

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient effective practice
body: Had day knee arthroscopy surgery at the Spire. Brought straight through to ward even though arrived an hour early. Welcomed straight away by nurses who were very attentive and individual introduced to various personal even prior to surgery including doctor, anaesthetist and physio. Superb set up and would highly recommend.

title: A big thankyou!
body:
Hi there,
I just want to say that I have been registered at the Palms Medical Centre for a very long time and overall I am very happy with it  The doctors genuinely care about their patients and go the extra mile.  The reception staff work so hard to support patients and are kind and polite.  I receive calls from the pharmacists to check and review my medication, and the nurse is so lovely.  It sounds like they are changing the phone system to improve the service so I can only speak as I find.  I would give it a very good and send a big thank you for all the help and support to myself and my family! ðŸ™‚

title: Helpful Ward
body: The staff on Kemerton ward were very supportive and helpful when I was there for a day procedure. They are also very professional in their health care.

title: Simply The Best
body: After having a bad experience at my local hospital at 29 weeks pregnant I transferred my care to Pembury. With a very high risk pregnancy due to health conditions and having a fifth c section I needed a team I could trust. All midwives & doctors were friendly and fantastic throughout, my care was A* - I literally couldnâ€™t fault a thing. My c section was booked and every risk factor was taken into account, the day of admission I was a nervous wreck but all staff were so reassuring and explained everything fully. Anaesthetists weâ€™re great as weâ€™re the Ob team, I was treated with care & compassion throughout. I have the neatest scar I e ever seen in my life, itâ€™s healed beautifully and no infection. Postnatal ward staff just amazing and attentive, I genuinely felt like I was receiving care in a private hospital in my side room complete with en suite & bed for my husband to stay the night. I am so glad I changed my care and cannot thank all theatre staff enough for delivering my darling daughter into this world safely, I owe you my life. Thank you so so much. Jessica Bangs

title: Great practice & reception staff
body: Reception staff will always accommodate any requests/queries that Iâ€™ve had. I have always been treated with respect and kindness, even though I can hear how busy they are in the background.

title: Great practice & reception staff
body: Reception staff will always accommodate any requests/queries that Iâ€™ve had. I have always been treated with respect and kindness, even though I can hear how busy they are in the background.

title: Poor caring system
body:
I stayed in AMU in Stepping hill hospital for about 10days and while I was staying nurses respond took more than 15min even I had high fever, also often took over 1-2hours to get a paracetamol without any reason. Also few of the nurses rubbed my arm too hard unnecessarily when they take blood so made huge bruises which left a lot of pain long time. Most of nurses didnâ€™t looked interested on patient and kept saying I donâ€™t understand and I donâ€™t know and talking privately front of patient even patient waiting for medication. Also couldnâ€™t sleep well because of too loud chatting and laughing sound all night. 

Specialists are mainly okay however their updates werenâ€™t clear. They didnâ€™t explain to me all the details of my test result which I asked. Also delayed discharge date day by day with everyday different doctors saying different reasons. It made me really confused.

title: Horrible Surgery
body: 3 weeks ago, I was having unsettling aches in my stomach and constant feeling of hunger, I tried feeling in their online questionnaire which promptly terminated due to the presumed seriousness of my aliment. I was advised to ring the surgery or 111, I rang the surgery and after about 2 mins, I got through to the receptionist who booked a callback appointment for me with a doctor. The doctor advised me to go into the hospital A&E for a blood test which I did the next day. I was informed that the GP would get back to me with arrangements for a surgery. I am still waiting and the pains are getting worse. I decided to call today and even though I expressed the seriousness of my pain, I couldn't get an appointment to ever speak to any doctor, let alone see one. To make matters worse, my out-patients appointment has been cancelled and rescheduled for 2 months time. It's very difficult to get an appointment or speak to a GP at this surgery.

title: No communication
body: Brought my son @9pm to A&E . it's 4am and still hasn't been seen. At midnight, a nurse told me that there is only one doctor and he is gone for an emergency. I complain at 4 am about the lack of communication then been invited to discharge of I will. This is for me not acceptable

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient service
body: I visited the Endoscopy unit. The whole journey through the department was very efficient and well run. However ,the most important aspect for me was that the staff were professional, but friendly and they all had a very caring attitude. They made an unpleasant procedure bearable. I get fed up with constant criticism of the NHS so I want to address the balance.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Cannot get an appointment
body:
I received a message that I needed a medication review.  I tried to book my appointment on line but it said there were no appointments available.  I went into the surgery to ask about booking a non urgent appointment. The receptionist spoke to me from the back of the reception area.  She was asking me all my personal Information which I had to shout for everyone to hear as the receptionist was far away and there was a plastic screen between us.  I had to repeat several times what the appointment was for.  I was told there were no appointments available for her to book and I should book online.  I explained I had tried but there were no appointments available to book online. She then asked me for my email address which I again had to repeat as she could not hear me properly.  After which she said she had sent me a link and I could book an appointment online.  She had sent me a patient access link, and didnâ€™t seem to understand that I already had one.  She then told me again to book online.  
What a complete waste of my time, I still have no appointment and yet I need a medication review.  
I had to reset my patient access password as she had sent me a new link and did not understand at all that I already had an active account.  Surely she should have been able to see that this is how I have been requesting my repeat medication and also booking my previous appointments.  
There was no privacy at the desk.  The receptionist could not hear me as she was too far away and everyone could hear my personal information. 
I have been with this surgery for 25 years and have seen the service gradually going downhill.  I know all GPS are stretched but this was the last straw.  It was an example of a complete lack of basic understanding as to what my problem was.  No empathy that I could not get an appointment. Setting up a patient access account for me that I already had.  A total lack of privacy.  All which left me coming away totally frustrated and still with no appointment.

title: terrible experience
body: i attended a&e for a suspected broken wrist  after a fall onto concrete. i have m.s  and  a few other health issues i was left on the metal chairs for 6hrs with not  being triaged no updates at all . people drunk some others screaming in agony ambulances queuing up with patients down the corridors  waiting for hrs . so i left still in agony   i still have the same suspected broken wrist . i will attend a different hospital and hopefully be treated . when i left to walk through the dept to get to the main entrance as the back of a&e is a building site i was informed by a bad attitude cleaner i couldnâ€™t walk through  the hospital as the doors had been locked so had to go out the back and go around the whole hospital to reach the front i sat and cried as i knew it would take me a good  half hr to cover this distance  this is totally unacceptable how are disabled people expected to attempt to cover the distance when they need to seek treatment  . i am totally horrified by the lack of treatment and care being given at pinderfields .

title: No transport
body: When asked about free transport to CHEC in Preston I was told there is none available for 3 months.It states on Checâ€™s website there is transport available.If the driver goes on holiday there is no replacement driver.

title: Bad very bad practice
body: I went for a ECG that was done by the nurse, after she took the result to the doc who was in his room...he decided to contact me through the nurse that keeps coming to me in the waiting room and going back to the doc...I found it rude unprofessional and lack of care and respect for the patient that was me...never I had a complaint before but now since the surgery had been taken over by a Syndeham group..has been bad,  uncaring....looks that I have to apologise because I am still alive..

title: Fantastic Doctor Support
body: Several Doctors and staff go beyond their remit of their Job description and care and support you outside of the surgery times. I would highly recommend this surgery to everyone. They supported my wife and I during the pandemic when she was diagnosed with progressive MS. At one point we though that we would loose my wife but the care and support we received was beyond incredible from the surgery. My wife is here today thanks to several of the doctors at the surgery and I could never thank them enough for what they have done for our family.

title: Brilliant service
body: My family have always been well looked after by beacon medical group. If an issue is urgent we can speak to a gp the same day or even see them in person. I am happy to wait if it isnâ€™t urgent. They are patient, donâ€™t rush and have always given clear honest advice and treatment. I feel my family is in good safe hands with this practice.

title: Wonderful
body: I had an appointment here recently, was seen by the specialist for an ultrasound, it was on time, very professional and talked me through it. Thank you for the quick appointment.

title: Thoughtful staff
body: I was cared for by lovely staff. My condition was a sensitive one but from reception to the nurse checking me over to the doctor who saw me I was handled with care, sensitivity and quickly and cannot praise Scarborough A&E enough â€¦ thank you

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service, thank you!
body: Everyone I encountered last Friday, from the receptionist in building 1, where I went by mistake, to everyone I met in the imaging department was kind, warm and professional. I should particularly like to mention the young lady who prepared me for the scan (I see that I can't mention her by name, sadly) who was very reassuring and made the whole experience easy for me. No waiting either. Great job everyone!

title: Fantastic treatment
body: I have had to visit this unit three times during the past five days and each time I have received excellent treatment delivered by friendly and very professional staff. I can't thank them enough, they really are fantastic. A real asset to the NHS.

title: Praise as quickly as complain .
body: Once again I can only praise staff involved with my appointment . The nurse involved was extremely /reassuringly knowledgeable & patient /thoroughly explaining issue & course of action . My only negative being they are ,understandably , moving onto an even greater role- well deserved ! Thank you & good luck .

title: Wonderful staff as always
body: I visited the Urgent Treatment Centre on 9/7/22 following a hand injury. From the start to the end of my treatment I was treated with respect, kindness and compassion. Everyone - the receptionist, triage nurse, radiographers and the nurses who patched me up - was friendly, warm and had a sense of humour. Upon arrival I was seen quickly by the triage nurse and taken straight to x-ray with no wait. Yes, I had to wait quite a while between x-ray and being seen again, but I expected that and have no complaints about it. So thank you, NHS at West Cornwall, once again. You truly are wonderful. To quote my favourite band Marillion and their song Care, "The angels of this world are not in the walls of churches". The angels are in the NHS.

title: What a brilliant team
body:
All of the staff that were involved in my care on Gate 21 were simply wonderful. Despite having to work within a system and circumstances that are highly challenging, each and very person demonstrated such empathy and care. We are so lucky to have such skilled, empathic and genuine people caring for us all. I hope the team that were working on Gate 21, Friday 8th July all know how appreciated they are.
Cat K.

title: fantastic staff
body: I was anxious that i was to be fitted with a midline but the head of intervention radiology made me so at ease and was so funny thankyou

title: Absolutely Dreadful
body:
I had three hours in the hospital. Had to wait to be told to wait again. Still wasnâ€™t seen. The staff on the desk didnâ€™t listen to me. They sent me to the wrong department. I phoned after I left to make an appointment and the operator was equally incompetent and extremely rude. 
The toilets had blood on the floor and the waiting was dirty with rubbish all over the seats. 
I discharged myself

title: great practice
body: i had an appointment with the practice nurse unfortunately cancelled but had to hand in a blood pressure chart but had my blood pressure meds increased a few weeks ago which led to swollen feet and ankles i mentioned this to the receptionist who made note to have someone phone me which they did and have reverted my meds back to the original prescription all in all a great service thank you

title: Question
body:
Why are there so many empty beds in the main corridor of york hospital? Last count 20 beds. Some of the beds have dirty linen on them. There are also a number of mattresses in a cage. 
All looks so untidy, cluttered & totally unprofessional

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor service
body:
Unable to sort out a straightforward referral
Sent for wrong blood tests
Can never get an appointment depends which receptionist you get
Would ring to make an prescription request and they wouldn't send it even though the agreement was they would do the prescription on a month script and chemist dispense it weekly due to risk

title: Disappointed
body: Much like the reviewa before me, called up at 6pm for advice for my 10 week old who has refused to feed over 48hrs, is profusely sick and very sleepy/generally not herself. Suspected UTI. Took an hour to get through via phone to triage, appreciate its busy. Get told based on my symptoms they'd want me to speak to a clinician within 1 hour but advised they're busy so could be over an hour. Receive a courtesy call over an hour later to apologise for the wait and reassure we are in a queue and will get to us. It is now  10 hours later and still no call. I can appreciate being busy, but when its for a baby there must be some kind of triage priority. I understand everyone thinks their case is important but at least an adult has the option of self care where a baby doesn't. Debating whether to go to A&E to be seen, which will put extra strain on them and is exactly what this 111 service was designed to avoid when GPs were closed. I waited in a&e in December in agony at 21 weeks pregnant for over 10 hours to be seen as the service was heaving without anyone checking my unborn baby or even asking if (she now) was moving. As a member or staff of the NHS, I feel a little embarrassed and disappointed by this service.

title: Waiting for a very long time
body: I have come here for my 12 months old baby for high fever (40Â°C). I have been waiting here for more than 9 hours. I came at 9:30 pm it's almost next day early morning 6:30. Thinking to walk out and sort it by ourselves

title: Indifferent service
body: I attended in person as per their instructions for an appointment. I was told it was a Telephone Appointment. Despite showing their instructions information not related to anything "Medical" was placed on a personal medical record which was misleading. No appointment was met. The administration arm of Caradoc needs caution.

title: Seems to get worse every day
body:
- The number on Google is no longer correct. Their number is only available via their own terrible website.

- When you do call itâ€™s a 30 minute wait time, to eventually be told they canâ€™t help you. That they have no appointments. That you should try again another time.

- Unable to get my newborn vaccinated. Unable to get appointments for myself. The reception staff have no interest in helping anyone with anything.

- Doctors are great, but that doesnâ€™t really matter when itâ€™s impossible to see one. Itâ€™s not even possible to get a phone appointment anymore.

title: First Class Treatment
body: I had cataract surgery on both eyes and cannot thank the staff and hospital enough. The surgery was painless and carried out quickly, professionally and punctually. The whole experience was made easier by the wonderful people who at all times were reassuring, kind and helpful. The surgeon was exceptional and the whole procedure was completed in 40 minutes. My life has been transformed as a result of this treatment and I can now lead a normal life. I will be forever grateful to all for this and will never be able to thank you enough for all that you have done. Be proud Tetbury Hospital, you and your staff are second to none !

title: Speedy and great care
body: I came into A&E yesterday at 7:20pm with my mother - sheâ€™d had a fall and we thought she had broken her ankle. After a very short wait (15mis) we saw a nurse, who then immediately sent us to minor injuries. Within 5 more minutes we saw another nurse who sent us for x-rays. No wait these were done and reviewed. She had indeed broken her ankle. A 3rd nurse gave us a boot, showed us how to use it and told us what care my mum needed to heal. We were then given the OK to go home. No less than 1.5 hours of being there. Every single staff member from reception, to the radiologist, to the 2 nurses in minor injuries were professional, kind, empathetic and helpful. Canâ€™t praise them enough. All doing their jobs to a high standard. And fast! Iâ€™m a little flabbergasted we moved so quick though the system. Perhaps it was quiet with everyone stuck on holiday in Spain or something. ðŸ˜‚â€¦but as I say. Fabulous job all round. Thank you!

title: MRI suite - good experience but improvementsâ€¦
body: Staff were lovely, very helpful and caring. Unfortunately, whoever organises the patient seating, in waiting room and MRI room has not taken into consideration that some patients are quite disabled and need higher seating. I physically struggled to get out of them, the chairs were far too low. This situation could, very easily, be resolved with just a small number of higher chairs with armrests. Also, I know it is personal choice whether to wear masks or not, but there is no option in the MRI scanner because the dept hasn't been provided with non metal masks. Because I am clinically vulnerable I bought my own non metal masks at a cost of Â£7, but it would be better it the dept could provide them.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely practice
body: Very friendly and kind staff .Very quick appointment sorted. No waiting. Carpark I'm find just cross the road and secure street.Waiting room was nice and clean and doctor was absolutely friendly.

title: Poor
body: I arrived at a&e at 6:50 pm due to being told to go due to presenting with tia stroke symptoms. I was seen and sent back to the waiting room at 7:43pm to wait to be seen by a doctor and left at 2:13 am without being seen. I asked four times how long it would take as id been sat for 7 hours waiting while 20+ people who came after me were seen before I was, I understand that the department was busy but this was a ridiculously long time to wait considering why I was there, very very disappointing.

title: Efficient care
body: Had another good appointment today. The doctor i saw listened and was thorough in his examination and suggested course of treatment. He explained details to me well when i asked and was very polite, kind and put me at ease. This is the kind of doctor everyone should have access to.

title: Very Pleasant clinic
body: What a lovely Atmosphere at Bridgend clinic, all staff were so helpful with my mobility issues. Lovely nurses.

title: Extremely long wait hours
body: I visited A&E with my 14 months old daughter who was vomiting persistently including a green vomit on an empty stomach. Firstly my mother who came with me wasnâ€™t allowed inside which was very rude and uncalled as the waiting area was empty.  When I came there were a maximum of 10 patients ahead of me, still had to wait FIVE hours to see a doctor. Doctor took blood sample and said results will be back in an hour - waited for 2.5 hours and the doctor said that the full results are not back because the blood is clotted and test cannot be performed. Seemed like it was a joke to them. Someone brought a sick child and after waiting for almost 9 hours, all they get told is to go home and bring again if situation worsens. Do not recommend as my child would have perhaps been feeling better at home than being treated carelessly at the hospital.

title: Good service for both routine and urgent problems
body: Ivel gets a bad rep on local social media, of which I think most is due to people having unnecessary expectations. I joined Ivel at the beginning of the pandemic and have had no problems with continuing my regular injections and no problems with my prescriptions either. I haven't needed them for anything urgent until recently when I was very painful the day after an op. I called in the morning and explained the situation and a doctor called me back within 15 minutes. I wasn't expecting such a speedy response and was very appreciative for this. I have always found reception to be helpful and reasonable when I have needed to call. Thank you!

title: undeniably the absolute best practice in town
body:
after having a serious amount of surgery in June 21, this practice really took the absolute best care of me, sending me back into hospital on numerous occasions when they thought fit and stemming from this my aftercare has been and continues to be first class.
Thank you is just not enough, I wish I could than all of you personally  for doing a first class job during exceptional times.

title: Utter joke
body: 31/2 hour wait time for a vulnerable 80 yr old woman 2 days post opp. Assured a quick time over the phone then told an hour wait on arrival only to be still sat in the waiting room. Reception staff incompetent, unprofessional and completely uninterested at best, staff move like they're on Â£3 an hour and spend more time chatting at the desk than seeing patients. Couldn't be happier that national insurance has dropped, hopefully it will result in lower wages for lazy inept staff. Avoid at all costs.

title: Complaint
body: Appalling service you carnt get through on the telephone and rude receptionist.  Can never get to see a doctor.

title: Dreadful Receptionist
body: There are many good employees working at this surgery, trying their best to raise the standards of service. The care coordinators are perfect examples, as they are efficient, knowledgeable, and helpful. However, the manager needs to ensure  the right calibre of staff are working on reception, as they are the face of the surgery. It is essential that the receptionist are pleasant, customer friendly, and professional. There is one particular receptionist who would be more suited to farm work, where she has no dealings with human beings. If the surgery doesn't get the receptionist trained to deal with the public in a decent manner, unfortunately there won't be any improvement at this surgery. One person can damage the reputation of the entire team.

title: Thank you
body:
Hi good people at A&E Turner Road.

Gosh you have a difficult job.

Thank you very much for your good attitudes and professionalism today.

Particular thanks to the physiotherapist who diagnosed the problem and treatment.

We love you Turner Road!

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Surprise Ablation
body:
Had an unexpected call to have my proceedure as there had been a cancellation. I had previously been pre-opped and prepared.  I arrived at 10.00 on Tuesday 21st June and was quickly signed in. After a wait I was prepared for the proceedure, including special theatre wear. My details were checked many times. The surgeon and the lead anesthetist interviewed my and pointed out some technical problems.
As I went under I felt confident that all would go well. The ablation was completed and the bruising has long since gone. The puncture wounds for the catheter have healed very quickly.
I was cared for in recovery by a patient nurse who ignored my snoring!
My wife met me on the Cardiac Ward, and I recovered well. Sadly, on my way out of the Cardiac Area I began to vomit and go dizzy. No doubt from the anesthesia. So I found myself in Ward 38. Where I received more good care! after more assessments
I was sent to the discharge lounge where plenty of refreshment was provided. Unfortunately I confused folk regarding my transport home so I did not set off until after 8.pm.  
My heart will settle down over the next few weeks I'm sure.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Better to see a Pharmacist
body:
My appointment was at 15:00hrs, arrived 10 minutes early with two patients in front of me. After 40 minutes another patient arrived and a second one for 16:00hrs .  All the patients were seen before me and Iâ€™d waited 1hr 20mins only to be dismissed as if wasting their time - that is the impression I was given.
Considering I had rung the previous day and was advised I would be rung in 2 to 3 hours time, I then had to ring12 hrs after my first call as no call had been forthcoming- I am not amused!

title: The heat on the wards!
body: Obviously all the staff are overworked etc. But the heat in the wards is absolutely ridiculous! Most patients are suffering with high temperature etc and the wards are so hot that everyone ( patients and staff) are all ratty and short tempered. Why can't you do something about this? It's such an obvious fix?

title: good care & attention
body: i was received, interviewed & treated with speed & respect. everyone was upbeat but caring. the surgery was completed swiftly. the after care was explained well. written info was also supplied. the whole experience was relaxed & comforting. it made a stressful  time very bearable. thank you.

title: Supurb Experience
body: I had my Cataract procedure on July 7th 2022 at the Oldham clinic.  Right from the greeting of the porter at the entrance to the Reception staff to the Nursing staff to the Surgeon and his team to the Post Op team everybody was absolutely supurb. After the initial preparation the actual procedure took approximately 15 to 20 minutes. I would strongly recommend that anyone requiring a Cataract procedure to get a referral to SpaMedica ( Oldham ). Thank you SpaMedica.

title: Amazing service, thank you!
body: I rang to ask if a doctor could call me at 12.30pm, had a call by 2.30pm and was prescribed the medication required and had prescription in my hand by 3pm! Whenever I request an appointment for anyone in my family the service is always faultless. Thank you very much to all staff.

title: Good overall service
body:
I have been registered here for a number of years, covid has changed the way everyone works including the GP's. I do like the telephone service as its less stressful when I need to be at work. Saying that I did come in and saw a nurse last wednesday who was excellent. I got the appointment on first call, waited till after the main rush at 8am, reception helpful and booked the appointment for a day and time that suited me.
thanks to the whole team, shame others are so negative all the time. If we had to pay for the service would they stil moan.  Thankyou Nuffield house

author: Gran2
title: Kilbryde Hospice Day Care was wonderful
body:
I was very reluctant to attend at first due to low self esteem and various health problems but was persuaded by Kirsten and Sheena (who visited me at home) and am so pleased I didðŸ˜„ as all the staff and volunteers were absolutely brilliant!  
(The lunch was great too so compliments to the chefs also).  
I had a wonderful experience and would recommend it to anyone who is apprehensive - you won't regret it. I missed a couple of sessions due to illness and was very sad when it finished, like leaving friends behind which is what the staff and volunteers had become.  
It is so hard to believe they are self funded - they are worth their weight in gold and silver. I feel very privileged.

title: Not suitable for suicidal patients
body:
Apparently they don't deal with urgent care but they will still wait months to refer to the appropriate service. 

They provide no information or support while you are on a waiting list for treatment.  They offer no alternatives and are unaware of what other services the NHS can provide.

The therapists leave you for months at a time without any contact and do not tell you when they don't intend to speak to you again.

I felt they did more harm than good.

readBy.name: Central and North West London Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Suitably knowledgeable to judge.
body:
I have been a patient of Litchdon Medical Centre since 1983. I have given Suitably Knowledgeable to judge as my review title due to my forty years experience working within the NHS. 
On first joining the practice while situated at Victoria Street Barnstaple and prior to its present location I had nothing but praise for each and every G.P. I came into contact with. This included the reception staff who were always pleasant and professional.
Some years after relocating to Newport Road there was the expected change in both G.P.s and Reception staff due mainly to retirement and progression onto other opportunities.
On the whole the practice maintained its position as one to recommend to relatives and friends.
Sadly in my case I started to notice a change in attitudes from certain G. P.s and the odd receptionist.
Without exposing those by name simply because one particular G.P. remains within the practice. I was infuriated by the manner and arrogance of the G.P. in question and also one locum who has now moved on.
Arrogance and a sense of apathy along with wrong diagnosis from the G.P. and the pathetic attempt to psychoanalyse me by the former locum.
â€˜Above all do no harmâ€™ might I remind any doctor who is privileged to be in a position to help cure that this does not simply refer to the physical side of medicine but also the psychological. For me to leave the practice feeling extremely angry and above all no better off than I felt before entering the practice did nothing at all to help me with what I considered and was later proven to be health issue of concern. 
I am very happy to report that my present G.P. was paying attention during their training at medical school regarding â€˜bedside  mannerâ€™
He / she has gone out of their way to show empathy while correctly treating my health concerns. As for the odd receptionist who was not only rude but also belligerent towards me I am happy that due to restructure of the building I no longer have to gaze upon her surly face. 
As previously stated I would still recommend Litchdon Medical Centre .

author: monocerostr38
title: Manor hospital MRI
body: I have had a referral from my consultant to get an MRI, but no matter what time I call or email I get no response from the MRI department. How can I get follow up treatment? I am paying for this treatment and deserve service.

author: Annoyed NHS user
title: Left waiting to be seen
body: I took my Son to a haematology appointment at Stepping Hill Hospital. We sat in a waiting area for over one hour and during all of that time two nurses sat doing absolutely nothing while one employee on reception spent the majority of that time looking at their mobile phone! NHS under pressure! Really?

author: CattieL22
title: Professional and very caring
body: A&E was hellish - no info just told to wait. 5 hours later I got through A&E - from thence on brilliant. Went to Ward 1 where a HCA Ulrika helped me efficiently to the scan room where I was swiftly scanned. On Ward 1 Nurse Helen is brilliant- even under all the stress she stays professional and very caring.She needs a medal!

author: Sw148
title: Poor Treatment
body:
I attended Accident and Emergency on Thursday being referred by my GP as my sugar levels were undetectable meaning they were higher than 28 and I had ketones. I have complex medical needs, pancreatitis, rare genetic condition which has caused my chronic pancreatitis. Previously I have had episodes of pancreatitis which I have had to fight for my life in intensive care numerous of times.  
When I arrived in A&E my ketones were increasing, I was becoming weaker and was beginning to feel nauseous including pain in my pancreas becoming unbearable. I waited over 2 hours before I was saw by a nurse. When I was taken, I saw by a very kind nurse who listened to all my complex health conditions and she ordered blood tests, due to my blood condition, it can mask true blood readings and I have a letter from my consultant in Glasgow who stated that all blood tests must be sent to Glasgow for them to be analysed or they can go atrial which gives a better reading.  
I expressed how sore my pancreas was becoming and informed them that I had taken oramorph (as I am prescribed) earlier and it was due.  
Shortly after this another nurse came and stated -aww you are a nurse arenâ€™t you, we are just going to move you to the corridor where we can keep an eye on you. I was moved to the corridor knowing that this wasnâ€™t the case. I began to vomit bile, pain was getting worse and I was left in a corridor.  
This nurse walked past me and I asked them what was happening and why I was being left in a corridor. I informed them of my pain and that I require pain killers and my oramorph. I said I had this with me and they told me to take my own if it will help. Do you know how embarrassing that was taking my oramorph out of my bag in front of a very busy corridor full of people to dispense my own.  
When they passed me a second time I asked again what was going on and he told me that A&E was full of â€œsickerâ€ people and I would be waiting hours to see a doctor as they need a bed as they are â€œmuch sickerâ€. I have never felt so worthless in my life!  
After what felt like an eternity I was saw by a medical doctor who was extremely patronising, stating the hospital was at full capacity, my blood levels are ok, I should go home as there's no beds.  
However, I told them that I normally see the surgical team as there's more to this and my pain is not manageable at home. I feel so embarrassed as I was crying in a corridor, full of paramedics and patients as your doctor and nurse made me feel like all I was after was pain killers, they werenâ€™t listening to me. However, I did finally see 2 surgeons who listened and properly examined me and admitted me to ward 4.  
I was in hospital for 6 days, in this time I was in DKA, I required a CT scan due to pancreas pain, they struggled to get my sugar levels stabilised, I was put on strong pain relief, IV Fluids, anti-sickness and I was put on a sliding scale to help with the DKA.  
Thankfully someone did listen or I would have gone into DKA at home without medical support. I am absolutely disgusted at how I was treat. For your staff to constantly say -youâ€™re a nurse you know how it is. Well actually, yes I am a nurse but on Thursday I was a patient who required and needed treatment to be treat so disgusting as my presentation wasnâ€™t â€œas sickâ€ as they would like!

title: Great staff
body: My daughter fractured her leg and she as autism and is non verbal all the staff was very caring and understood my worries that she couldn't tell them what happened and where it hurts we went for xrays and the staff there was amazing also understood everything about my daughter and helped me settle her we was in there for 7 and half hours but the staff made sure we both was OK and kept us updated on how long it will be till we was allowed home

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: An extremely  high standard hospital
body:
I had an excellent & safe experience for a cataract operation at SpaMedica Hospital Birkenhead 
Thank you

title: Fantastic service
body: Enquired about blood test and issue relating to my concerns etc.. felt assured that help 'was on its way' by the administration team, sorted a phone call and was able to allow someone talk for me in my absence due to work (nhs shifts) had the phone call, taken by an excellent doctor. Cannot thankyou enough for the help I have received as I have not only had reduced symptoms since medication but my blood test has been expanded to find potential issues relating to my issue which i dodnt think of, i feel really great about the practice and the help received. Social media doesn't observe the great team you guys have only the negative... boo to them, please keep up the good work. ðŸ‘

title: So glad I am with this practice ðŸ™Œ
body: Parklands have always been brilliant and despite the difficulties in booking a routine appointment since the pandemic, the receptionists always find a way for you to be seen either in the surgery or elsewhere if your issue is urgent. Highly recommended!

title: Prompt telephone response & action
body:
Having uploaded photographs, my Doctor followed up with a text message and prescription in a very timely manner. A referral to a dermatologist has now been made and I await an appointment.
The service I experienced was good and the GP helpful and friendly although I do miss the face to face interaction of days gone by and believe some medical issues must be very difficult for the Dr's to accurately assess via econsult.
I missed a phone call as I am not permitted to have a mobile in my childcare workplace however thankfully the Dr left a text message. 
Overall an efficient consultation and follow up. Thank you Beacon Medical.

title: Amazing practice
body:
Saw a wonderful lady GP this morning who was extremely compassionate towards my situation.
Just wanted to thank her and all the amazing staff for being so caring.

title: Great Practice
body: My family have had excellent care from the GPS at Bodmin Road. The media has gone on about lack of service since covid.Whilst I know this has been difficult times, this GP service has continued to offer appointments and service through out. They are all so lovely and supportive so thank you.

title: Fantastic service
body: My daughter stayed on the childrens ward for 3 nights, she had wonderful care by all staff, the nurses and HCAs always so kind and friendly through being extremely busy. All the doctors were lovely and very thorough. The childrens ward has such a wonderful play room and garden which really makes such a difference to the children. Thank you childrens ward!

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Good practice
body:
I was easily able to make an appointment.The vaccination nurse was super nice and helpful. The nurse called us in on time. There was minimal waiting time. 
Nurse was very friendly and polite and made the visit easy and calm.

title: Excellent Practice
body: The receptionists are knowledgeable and extremely helpful. Calls answered quickly and call back by doctor always within three hours. Doctors have given quality care with great understanding and expertise leading to helpful treatment. Top class practice.

title: Access on weekends
body: I sent an e-consult on Saturday evening hoping to get a response on Monday but I got a response on Sunday and subsequent email and I was very impressed with this. I think it is very impressive and I would like to say a big thank you to the person working on there weekend.

title: Friendly
body: Staff are always friendly and professional.polite and helpful. Surgery is comfortable and relaxed. Never any problems or faults

title: Really excellent service. I could not fault it
body: I telephoned on Monday morning 4th July and explained my problem to a most helpful receptionist. I was advised that a doctor would ring me back and she did. I was seen later in the day.

title: Great Practice
body: I have in the last 2 years experienced more illness than at any other time in my life. I cannot fault the service i have received from Elliot Hall .

title: Exceptional care
body: I was in ward 16 for a bowel operation. Surgeons/  anaetheatists/ theatre staff all put me at ease and I felt safe. Cannot remember recovery ward but when back on the main ward ALL staff made me comfortable.  Nurses work SO hard.And their patience is oustanding.All deserve a pat on the back!!!!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great support
body: My experience was excellent â€¦ I was contacted very quickly by a friendly caring nurse who explained everything in detail and gave me additional information on out of hours contacts â€¦ this was very helpful â€¦ I was able to collect a prescription on the same day but was assured that if my condition did not improve I should contact the surgery immediately â€¦ there is a great deal of pressure in this sector and a lot of negativity so I though it would be appropriate to put my own positive experience on here â€¦ thank you to you all for all you do.

title: Wonderful care
body:
My Parkinsonâ€™s sufferer husband attended A&E for severe pain in his hip and leg. The care he received from everyone was amazing but we are particularly grateful to the wonderful doctor who looked after him so gently and thoughtfully . In spite of the demands of a very busy Dept. his individual needs were attended to and he was reassured . The doctor clearly explained and advised us about his care so considerately and with great sensitivity . 
We would like to express our thanks to everyone - particularly the nurses and physiotherapists . His condition is already improving and we will always be grateful for a very positive experience .

title: amazing practice
body: excellent staff, right from the men who met us at the entrance the young man at the reception desk, the nursing staff and the surgeons, all who were friendly and professional they helped my husband Jack feel relaxed and positive. We thank them all so much. Jack managed to get a cancellation for the operation  so it was all done very quickly.  Thank you Spa Medica

title: Friendly & Helpful
body: Both the receptionist & the nurse who took my bloods this morning were friendly, helpful & efficient. Thank you!
